body:
**What happened**:
When I restart pod with my driver and driver-registrar, node looses NodeID annotation.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

1. Run Kubernetes without any alpha features (local-up-cluster.sh in this case)

2. Start HostPath driver
    ```
    kubectl create serviceaccount csi-node-sa
    kubectl create serviceaccount csi-attacher
    kubectl apply -f test/e2e/testing-manifests/storage-csi/hostpath/hostpath/
    ```

3. Wait for everything to be Running

4. Check the node has annotation
    ```
    kubectl get node -o yaml

    annotations:
      csi.volume.kubernetes.io/nodeid: '{"csi-hostpath":"127.0.0.1"}'
    ```

4. Delete the node pod (deleting all pods here, we don't care about attacher/provisioner).
    ```
    kubectl delete pod --all
    ```
   
5. DaemonSet will start a new node pod with new registrar. Wait until the new pod gets Running.

6. Check the node **does not have the annotation**
    ```
    kubectl get node -o yaml

     <no annotations>
    ```

It's ~~100%~~ 80% reproducible in my local cluster. New driver-registrar deletes socket of the old registrar and creates new one. I can see in logs:

```
I1126 16:48:23.914792   31674 plugin_watcher.go:347] DeRegistering plugin {CSIPlugin csi-hostpath} at path /var/lib/kubelet/plugins_registry/csi-hostpath-reg.sock
I1126 16:48:23.914886   31674 csi_plugin.go:227] kubernetes.io/csi: registrationHandler.DeRegisterPlugin request for plugin csi-hostpath
I1126 16:48:23.919670   31674 csi_plugin.go:116] kubernetes.io/csi: Trying to validate a new CSI Driver with name: csi-hostpath endpoint: /var/lib/kubelet/plugins/csi-hostpath/csi.sock versions: 1.0.0, foundInDeprecatedDir: false
I1126 16:48:23.919756   31674 csi_plugin.go:137] kubernetes.io/csi: Register new plugin with name: csi-hostpath at endpoint: /var/lib/kubelet/plugins/csi-hostpath/csi.sock
```

So the old socket was deregistered very shortly before new one got registered. IMO these two operations collide with each other and the deregistration "wins" somehow.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): today's master

/kind bug
/sig storage

@saad-ali @bertinatto @msau42 @vladimirvivien @verult @davidz627
